case.state: Is this The Inventory? It seems like my articles on it are a bit outdated. Time for a dive into the source!
Telltale's The Inventory seems to have changed a bit... Which means that I need to update my articles! Time for a first-person dive into the source!
Oh, so the article on The Inventory wasn't vandalized. It is a strip poker club now! Those articles need to be updated, and I am here for it!
I'm used to playing poker at the sea, but never strip poker! This will be exciting!
The sound of waves is so relaxing. I'm sure this will make for a better, more pleasant game...
Hello, Doctor! It's so nice to see you here! Ready to continue with our illegal experiments for Black Mesa?
Hello, Gordon! I thought you died in All Dogs Go to Heaven 2. Now, behave and do not say a word about our involvement with Black Mesa, or I {b}will kill you!{!reset}
Hello everyone! The name is Wikipe-tan, and I came here to study the Inventory's strip poker scene!
Welcome to another session of strip poker sponsored by the Inventory. My name is Wikipe-tan, and I will be your opponent this game.

{small}Batman is a superhero who appears in American comic books published by DC Comics. Batman was created by artist Bob Kane and writer Bill Finger, and debuted in the 27th issue of the comic book Detective Comics on March 30, 1939. In the DC Universe continuity, Batman is the alias of Bruce Wayne, a wealthy American playboy, philanthropist, and owner of Wayne Enterprises based in Gotham City. Kane, Finger, and future DC writers accompanied Batman with supporting characters, including his sidekick Robin, allies Alfred Pennyworth and James Gordon, and foes such as Catwoman, the Scarecrow, the Penguin, and his archenemy, the Joker. Since his first appearance in 1939, Batman has been adapted into various media such as film, radio, television, and video games, as well as numerous merchandising items. The Batman franchise has become one of the highest-grossing media franchises of all time.{!reset}

{small}Cowboy Bebop is a Japanese science fiction anime television series animated by Sunrise featuring a production team led by director Shinichirō Watanabe, screenwriter Keiko Nobumoto, character designer Toshihiro Kawamoto, mechanical designer Kimitoshi Yamane, and composer Yoko Kanno. The twenty-six episodes, also called "sessions," of the series are set in the year 2071, and follow the lives of a bounty hunter crew traveling in their spaceship called the Bebop.{!reset}

{small}Dota 2 is a multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) video game developed and published by Valve. The game is a sequel to Defense of the Ancients (DotA), which was a community-created mod for Blizzard Entertainment's Warcraft III: Reign of Chaos and its expansion pack, The Frozen Throne. Dota 2 is played in matches between two teams of five players, with each team occupying and defending their own separate base on the map. Each of the ten players independently controls a powerful character, known as a "hero", who all have unique abilities and differing styles of play. During a match players collect experience points and items for their heroes to successfully defeat the opposing team's heroes in player versus player combat. A team wins by being the first to destroy the other team's "Ancient," a large structure located within their base.{!reset}

{small}Fate/Apocrypha is a Japanese light novel series in Type-Moon's Fate franchise, written by Yūichirō Higashide and illustrated by Ototsugu Konoe. Type-Moon published five volumes from December 2012 to December 2014.{!reset}

{small}My Little Pony: Equestria Girls, or simply Equestria Girls, is a product line of fashion dolls and media franchise launched in 2013 by American toy company Hasbro, as a spin-off of the 2010 relaunch of the My Little Pony franchise and its Friendship Is Magic television series. Equestria Girls features anthropomorphized versions of My Little Pony characters from that period. It includes various doll lines, media tie-ins and licensed merchandises.{!reset}

{small}Teen Titans is an American animated superhero television series developed by Glen Murakami and Sam Register, based on DC Comics's superhero team of the same name. During its run, the series was nominated for three Annie Awards and one Motion Picture Sound Editors Award.{!reset}

{small}Harry Potter is a series of seven fantasy novels written by British author, J. K. Rowling. The novels chronicle the lives of a young wizard, Harry Potter, and his friends Hermione Granger and Ron Weasley, all of whom are students at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.{!reset}

{small}Undertale is a 2D role-playing video game created by indie developer Toby Fox. It is notorious for being an RPG where the player can opt to pacify or subdue monsters in order to spare them instead of killing them.{!reset}

{small}StarCraft is a military science fiction media franchise created by Chris Metzen and James Phinney and owned by Blizzard Entertainment. The series centers on a galactic struggle for dominance among three species—the adaptable and mobile Terrans, the ever-evolving insectoid Zerg, the powerful and enigmatic Protoss—in a distant part of the Milky Way galaxy known as the Koprulu Sector.{!reset}

{small}Sonic the Hedgehog is a Japanese video game series and media franchise created and owned by Sega in 1991. The franchise follows Sonic, an anthropomorphic blue hedgehog who battles the evil Doctor Eggman, a mad scientist.{!reset}

{small}Katawa Shoujo (translated as: "Cripple Girls" or "Disability Girls") is a bishoujo-style visual novel by Four Leaf Studios that tells the story of a young man and five young women living with varying disabilities.{!reset}

{small}RWBY (pronounced "Ruby") is an American anime-influenced animated web series and media franchise created by Monty Oum. It is set in the world of Remnant, where young people train to become warriors to protect their world from monsters called Grimm.{!reset}

{small}Fire Emblem is a fantasy tactical role-playing game franchise developed by Intelligent Systems and published by Nintendo. First produced and published for the Famicom in 1990, the series currently consists of seventeen core entries and three spinoffs. Gameplay revolves around the tactical movement of characters across grid-based environments, while incorporating a story and characters similar to traditional role-playing video games.{!reset}

{small}Pokémon, also known as Pocket Monsters in Japan, is a Japanese media franchise managed by The Pokémon Company, a company founded by Nintendo, Game Freak, and Creatures. The franchise was created by Satoshi Tajiri in 1995, and is centered on fictional creatures called "Pokémon", which humans, known as Pokémon Trainers, catch and train to battle each other for sport.{!reset}

{small}HuniePop is a tile-matching and dating sim adult video game created by American game designer Ryan Koons, under the alias of HuniePot. The game follows the dating adventures of the main character as they try to woo several different women in their hometown.{!reset}

{small}Street Fighter is a Japanese fighting video game franchise first developed and published by Capcom in 1987. It is one of the highest-grossing video game franchises of all time and serves as one of Capcom's flagship series, as well as the highest-grossing media franchise of all time based on a fighting game.{!reset}

{small}Little Witch Academia is a Japanese anime franchise created by Yoh Yoshinari and produced by Trigger. It's story takes place at Luna Nova Magical Academy, a prestigious school for young girls training to become witches.{!reset}

{small}Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir is a French-Italian-Japanese-South Korean computer-animated superhero television series. The series focuses on two Parisian teenagers, Marinette Dupain-Cheng and Adrien Agreste, who transform into the superheroes Ladybug and Cat Noir, respectively, to protect the city from supervillains.{!reset}

{small}Doki Doki Literature Club! is a 2017 American freeware visual novel developed by Team Salvato. The story is told from the perspective of a male high school student who joins the school's literature club in an attempt to woo one of its four female members. Although this game initially appears to be a lighthearted dating simulator, it is in fact a{!reset} [̛R̨̕E͢D̶҉̡ÁC̛͝T̵̛̀E͡D̸̡͢]̵̧͝ {small}[citation needed]{!reset}

{small}League of Legends is a 2009 multiplayer online battle arena video game developed and published by Riot Games, a subsidiary of Chinese conglomerate Tencent. Inspired by Defense of the Ancients, a custom map for Warcraft III, the game has been free-to-play and is monetized through purchasable character customization since its release.{!reset}

{small}Overwatch is a 2016 team-based multiplayer first-person shooter developed and published by Blizzard Entertainment. Described as a "hero shooter", Overwatch assigns players into two teams of six, with each player selecting from a large roster of characters, known as "heroes", with unique abilities.{!reset}

{small}Brawl Stars is a freemium mobile video game developed and published by the Finnish video game company Supercell. Released worldwide on December 12, 2018, the game features various game modes, which can be completed with a selection of Brawlers that can be controlled with on-screen joysticks.{!reset}

{small}KonoSuba: God's Blessing on this Wonderful World! is a Japanese light novel series written by Natsume Akatsuki. The series follows Kazuma Satou, a boy who is sent to a fantasy world with MMORPG elements following his death, where he forms a dysfunctional party with a goddess, an archwizard, and a crusader.{!reset}

{small}Star Trek is an American science fiction media franchise originating from the 1960s television series Star Trek, created by Gene Roddenberry. That series, now often known as "The Original Series," debuted in 1966, and aired for three seasons on NBC. It followed the voyages of the starship USS Enterprise, a space exploration vessel built by the United Federation of Planets in the 23rd century, on a mission "to explore strange new worlds, to seek out new life and new civilizations, to boldly go where no man has gone before."{!reset}

{small}Galatea is an interactive fiction video game by Emily Short featuring a modern rendition of the Greek myth of Galatea, the sculpture of a woman which gained life. The game displays an unusual rich approach to non-player character dialogue and diverts from the typical puzzle-solving in interactive fiction: the whole gameplay is based on the interaction with a single character in a single room.{!reset}
Finally, another player who is just as inquisitive as I am!
I do not know how you will be able to strip... but this is information that I will be writing down in the article!
Although I lack sources on this, I sense vandals and criminals at this table. I will try to enjoy myself, but I will not lower my guard!
Hello, everyone! My name is Wikipe-tan, and I came here to have a good time, as well as to study this place!
Greetings, everyone! You can call me Wikipe-tan. I came here to write an article on this place, as well as to experience its fun on my own!
According to poker statistics, I should swap these cards.

I am going to swap cards.
But I will not tell you which ones. That would spoil the fun!
In poker, the probability of each type of 5-card hand can be computed by calculating the proportion of hands of that type among all possible hands.
The development of poker probability theory in the late 1400s was attributed to gambling; when playing a game with high stakes, players wanted to know what the chance of winning would be.
Did you know that the probability of a royal flush is 0.000154% ?

Here's a fun fact:
The probability of drawing a straight flush is 0.00139%
Should I...? No, not according to that article...
Is that blue hair I see? Well, it is nice to see that I am in good company. And might I just say that it looks exquisite on you!
All the pieces are falling into place.
It looks like all those hours at article speedrunning are paying off!
I have read every article on poker there is, and even spellchecked some of them. Do you really think I will be an easy opponent to beat?
Are you just learning how to play poker? Is this why we're playing Cantrell draw? I am up for the challenge if anyone wants to play a more complicated variant.
I have nothing to worry about this round. How about a fun fact? Is there any topic you would like to know more about, ~player~?
I hope you were expecting someone else to strip. If you were looking to see more of me, you are up for disappointment.
...Where are we, exactly? I could offer my knowledge on whether this game of poker is legal or not. But that is heavily dependant on our current location... Which nobody seems to know.

{small}Poker tournaments are legal in Paris as long no real money is offered as a prize. As for nudity, there are 2.6 million people in France who make social nudity a part of their lifestyle, with Paris being the most popular city in Europe for the practice.{!reset}
"Poker Face" is a song by American singer Lady Gaga from her debut studio album, The Fame (2008). It was released on September 26, 2008, as the album's second single.

{small}A poker face, also known as a blank expression, is a facial expression characterized by neutral positioning of the facial features, implying a lack of strong emotion. Not to be confused with Lady Gaga's song "Poker Face."{!reset}

{small}Five-card draw, which is also known as a Cantrell draw, is a poker variant that is considered the simplest variant of poker, and is the basis for video poker. As a result, it is often the first variant learned by new players.{!reset}
I do not enjoy being called a Captain Obvious, by the way. Just making it clear.
It is always advisable to go for a safer hand, like a pair or two pair; however, if you suspect that your opponents have similar hands as well, you might be safer going for riskier plays.
{small}A poker face may be caused by a lack of emotion, depression, boredom or slight confusion, such as when someone refers to something which the listener does not understand.{!reset}

{small}A deliberately-induced blank expression meant to conceal one's emotions is what people refer to as a poker face, referring to the common practice of maintaining one's composure when playing the card game poker.{!reset}
Remember that if you wish for me to talk about a certain topic, you can tell me anytime in a bug report or at the end of the game. I do not mind, really, I live to learn and inform!

By the way... Wikipedia runs on donations from people like you and me who value information and want it to be free and accessible to anyone. So... you know.
Pretty please?

{small}"Poker Face" is a synthpop song in the key of G♯ minor, following in the footsteps of her previous single "Just Dance," but with a darker musical tone. The main idea behind the song is bisexuality and was a tribute by Gaga to her rock and roll boyfriends. The song's lyrics feature various sexual innuendos.{!reset}
If there is any question you would like me to answer, you can ask freely! I might not have all the answers, or all the correct information, but I do try my best to spread knowledge anyway!
Poker is, first and foremost, a game of mathematical calculations. You must be able to measure chance and percentages before playing, and only then is when luck gets involved.
Even this variant of poker has different sub-variant with funny names, such as Spit in the Ocean, Shotgun and Anaconda.
As much as I love writing articles, I have to admit that Wikipedia is not a reliable source. Do not use it for your college or workplace projects, please.

... {small}Cock and ball torture (CBT), penis torture or dick torture is a sexual activity involving application of pain or constriction to the penis or testicles. This may involve directly painful activities, such as genital piercing, wax play, genital spanking, squeezing, ball-busting, genital flogging, urethral play, tickle torture, erotic electrostimulation, kneeing or kicking. The recipient of such activities may receive direct physical pleasure via masochism, or emotional pleasure through erotic humiliation, or knowledge that the play is pleasing to a sadistic dominant. Many of these practices carry significant health risks. {!reset}
Someone vandalized this hand...
I need to re-read articles on poker strategies...
I should have spent more time reading about poker strategies instead of cleaning up articles about popular media...
Do not blame Wikipedia for unreliable information! We are a free encyclopedia that anyone can edit, so we constantly face vandalism such as "trolls" and "shitposters"!
...S-say, how about a fun fact instead? Is there anything you want to know, ~player~? I can do research if I do not know the answer!
I-I got a good hand this time! {small}[citation needed]{!reset}
If I were to ask for a donation now, I could certainly use a better hand...
*gasp* It is your birthday? Well, happy birthday, Ms. Gisborn! We do not have this info on the Wikipedia page about you. It must be added immediately!
You propose a good challenge. I do love learning new information... Alright, deal!
Oh! I have a dream to spread free, easy-to-access information around the world! And I am working to make it a reality!
I noticed that our article on the Inventory was missing information, and I decided to do some independent research to update it.
There were reports coming in that the Inventory had been converted into a Strip Poker club, but I never know what to believe with all these vandals, so I decided to check it out for myself.
I wanted to see if I could secure donations. Wikipedia needs any help it can get to stay free and open for everyone, so... pretty please?
W-well, I don't know if I can add much experience, Ms. Meia. I only have experience as an aeronautical radio operator, I've never even flown a plane before, much less a spaceship!
Ooh! Ooh! My favorite holiday is January 15! That's the day Wikipedia was founded!
Well, I am obviously named for Wikipedia, but the -tan in my name is an affectionate suffix, in the form of a Japanese honorific.
No, I have two sisters, Commons-tan and Quote-tan. I wonder what they would think about me being here today...
I have two sisters, actually! Commons-tan and Quote-tan. Together, we are unstoppable in delivering information to the world!
I have two sisters, Commons-tan and Quote-tan. They always used to tease me when we were growing up. But who needs them, anyway?
{b}Dance{!reset} is a performing art form consisting of sequences of movement, either improvised or purposefully selected. This movement has aesthetic and often symbolic value.
Perhaps it is a cliche, but I believe that knowledge is the ultimate power! Apart from that, I would like the ability to fly.
And I would love to assist in answering your questions in any way that I can, Ms. Luxanna!
The presentation of pubic shaving is regarded by some as being erotic and aesthetic, while others consider the style as unnatural.
The removal of pubic hair was popularized in pornography. Since then, pubic shaving became mimicked by women.
Wikipedia has many articles on monsters of various kinds! We also have articles on the Steppenwolf album Monster, and the 2010 song "Monster" by Kanye West.
A {b}golem{!reset} is an animated anthropomorphic being in Jewish folklore that is created entirely from inanimate matter (usually clay or mud).
A {b}golem{!reset} is not to be confused with Gollum, the character in J. R. R. Tolkien's The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings.
I cannot say I am all-seeing or all-knowing, but I do have knowledge from the 6.2 million articles that our loyal editors have contributed and continue to edit!
Apologies for the misunderstanding, Polly. I did not mean to offend you. I was merely stating what the article on Poltergeist says on Wikipedia.

{small}You have arrived in the 21st (twenty-first) century of the Common Era! We are not the spacefaring society that many had believed we would be by this point, but as far as technology goes, more than half of the world's population has obtained access to the internet!{!reset}
Imperial Princess Estelle! It is an honor to be playing with you. Do you play strip poker often? You seem to have a lot of knowledge about the Inventory, and I could use a guide like you!
Princess Charlie Magne! It is a pleasure to meet your acquaintance. I have heard much about you and your hotel!

Did you know that the probability of drawing a four of a kind is 0.0240%?
Such a random, fun fact, right?

Here is a fun fact! The probability of drawing a full house is 0.1441% .
Which is actually higher than drawing a four of a kind!

A {b}vampire{!reset} is a creature from folklore that subsists by feeding on the vital essence (generally in the form of blood) of the living. Everything else changes depending on the culture and its folklore.

{small}In law, an alien is any person (including an organization) who is not a citizen or a national of a specific country, although definitions and terminology differ to some degree depending upon the continent or region of Earth. More generally, however, the term "alien" is perceived as synonymous with foreign national.{!reset}

{small}A catgirl is a female kemonomimi character with cat traits, such as cat ears, a cat tail, or other feline characteristics on an otherwise human body. They are found in various fiction genres and in particular Japanese anime and manga.{!reset}

A {b}demon{!reset} is a supernatural being, typically associated with evil. The original Greek word did not carry negative connotations, so it is safe to assume that they were added by medieval Christian demonology.

A {b}deity{!reset} or {b}god{!reset} is a supernatural being considered divine or sacred. It is often described as a being with powers greater than those of ordinary humans, but who interacts with humans, positively or negatively.
An {b}adventurer{!reset} is someone who seeks out adventures, exciting experiences that are typically bold, sometimes risky or undertaking.
{b}Angels{!reset} are supernatural beings in various religions often depicted as benevolent celestial intermediaries between God or Heaven and humanity, or protectors and guides for humans.
A {b}witch{!reset} is a practitioner of magical skills and abilities such as using spells, incantations and magical rituals. Any other exact details get blurried by cultural context.

A {b}superhero{!reset} is a stock character that possesses abilities beyond those of ordinary people, who typically uses their powers to help the world become a better place, protecting the public, and fighting crime.

{small}Air (desambiguation). Air is part of the Earth atmosphere that humans breathe. It's made up of 78% Nitrogen, 21% Oxygen, and 1% other (including water, vapor). Air may also refer to: Music - Air (music), French for aria, various song-like vocal or instrument compositions.{!reset}
What do you mean that Henry Cavill is not dead? Do you have a source for that? I need to fix that article as soon as possible!
(I accidentally brought the old piece of the Japanese Wikipedia logo... I hope nobody notices that my ウ is missing a line...)

{small}Remember to not believe everything you read on Wikipedia. On October 2012, the asian soccer's governing body was forced to apologize to the United Arab Emirates soccer team for for referring to them as the "Sand Monkeys"; the spurious nickname had been taken from a vandalized Wikipedia article.{!reset}

Did you know that Wikipedia has a Simple English edition? It is a very useful resource for ESL people, uneducated people or younger people. {small}(But if you are so young that you do not understand regular Wikipedia, you should not be playing this game!){!reset}
Of course I can answer your questions! I do not know everything, however. I only know things people care enough about to write for the rest of the world to know.
Aw, come on! Someone is clearly vandalizing this hand!
This is preposterous! Outrageous! How likely was this to happen? I want a source cited on that!
Who is dealing these cards?! I want to verify their sources! This has to be apropos!
Okay, SOMEONE must be vandalizing my hands! THIS IS NOT FAIR!!
Again?! That seems rather suspicious... Something is wrong, I can feel it!
So I'm first, huh? I guess I need to re-read the article on poker techniques, heh...
Well, that was... unexpected. We don't have an article on how much of a blow to my ego it was for me to lose first.
I suppose I had to lose at some point.
Well... It is a game of chance after all. Not all rounds can be won.
Good plays, everyone. Allow me to recompense your efforts.
I should commend you on your skills. But since this poker variant is mostly based on chance, that statement would require more accurate sources.

I believe this is one of the reasons people prefer this poker variant. The increased importance of luck makes all rounds unpredictable, while every layer lost makes every round spicier than the one before...
I suppose I had to lose at some point.
I should commend you on your skills. But since this poker variant is mostly based on chance, that statement would require more accurate sources.
I do not think removing my shoes is interesting at all, so I will proceed to tell you all about one of my most treasured childhood movies.
Well... It is a game of chance after all. Not all rounds can be won.
Good plays, everyone. Allow me to recompense your efforts.

I believe this is one of the reasons people prefer this poker variant. The increased importance of luck makes all rounds unpredictable, while every layer lost makes every round spicier than the one before...
Good plays, everyone. Allow me to recompense your efforts.
I was sure I was at least decent at this game... Looks like I did not read enough articles on the matter.

{small}All Dogs Go to Heaven 2 is a 1996 American animated musical fantasy adventure film, and a sequel to Goldcrest Films' animated film All Dogs Go to Heaven (1989). This film is notorious because it depicts the death of Doctor Gordon Freeman, who...{!reset}
It is customary to start with your shoes or other accessories in games like these. Unless you want to surprise your opponents.
Most strip poker players start by stripping something decent and/or superfluous. In this case, I will start with my shoes.

An apron is a garment that is worn over other clothing and covers mainly the front of the body. The word comes from old French napron, meaning a small piece of cloth; however, over time "a napron" became "an apron."
An apron is mostly known as a functional accessory that protects one's clothes and skin from stains and marks.
Various types of aprons may also be worn as a decoration, for hygienic reasons, as part of a uniform, or as protection from certain dangers such as acid, allergens, or excessive heat.
If you were hoping for traditional bra and panties, you might be in for a surprise...
I might be as open and easy to read as a book, but even I hold some surprises...
Well, there go the stockings then. I hope you enjoyed watching me wear them!
I was under the impression that wearing the stockings with the swimsuit would accentuate the fanservice aspect of the outfit. But if you desire me to strip them off, I will...
Do not expect me to take it all at once. Every other girl wears a bra and panties, so it would only be fair for me to have two chances!
I consulted with the administration early on, and they were okay with me stripping the swimsuit in two turns. I hope you are not disappointed!
W-well... There it goes then. You will see all of me like I was an open article for everyone to read...
I cannot believe it has come to this... But oh well...
...Hey, wait a second. That article was vandalized! How dare they! I HATE it when they vandalize articles like that!
As the game goes on, I might lose again, and I will strip more and more clothes until there is nothing left.
This may have been an easy strip, but future ones will not be as uninteresting as this one.
Next up comes my apron. Do you think you will get me to take it off?
Do not get used to seeing me strip, by the way. This is the last time I will ever do it. {small}[citation needed]{!reset}
Aprons can be used in work stations to hold extra tools and pieces or protecting from dust and unwanted products. I will get mine back as soon as I beat you!
I am going to miss this apron. My cosplay maid outfit feels incomplete without it. But if I win, I can get it back.
As the representative for the WikiProject for Anime and Manga, I have to be prepared to multitask, such as representing cosplay culture and swimsuit fanservice as well!

It might seem to be counterintuitive to wear a swimsuit under a dress, but as the representative for both the fanservice article and the WikiProject for Anime and Manga, I have to be ready to multitask!
Now only my swimsuit remains. Will you be able to take me out of it?
I like this swimsuit. I hope you like it too, since it is going to be a while until you get me to strip out of it.
There is nothing wrong with my breasts, is there? The way you are looking at them is... Oh, I get it. You are aroused! This is great!
At least you will get to watch my breasts for a while. But I will try harder to win now! So do not expect to see more!
Just like a well-written article. Organized, neat, and perfectly trimmed!
This is it then. All of me. I hope you are not disappointed...
Responsible hygiene is crucial for a healthy sex life. A trimmed crotch is a good balance between tidiness and naturality.
I am as dilligent with my body hygiene as I am with my articles! I try to keep a good shape and a neat, trimmed crotch. And I am proud of it!
But... it is in the title? I am unsure of how you could have missed such an obvious fact.
Technically, you did sign up for it. So, it is your move!
It is an honor to play with another internet famous -Tan. Despite your more... adult tendencies colliding with its original meaning.

{small}In ghostlore, a poltergeist is a type of ghost or spirit that is responsible for physical disturbances, such as loud noises and objects being moved or destroyed. The word comes from Germanic languages, meaning "noisy ghost."{!reset}
It is an honor to play with you, Princess Twilight. Have you considered adding your equestrian knowledge to Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia that anyone can edit?
Ms. Granger, right? Do you think there is any chance for the wizarding world to ever share their knowledge with us muggles?
Ms. Granger, right? Do you think there is any chance for the wizarding world to ever share their knowledge with us muggles?
Amy Rose! It is a pleasure to meet you. Have you had any luck with Sonic recently?
A tie? Now this is certainly unexpected! These are very rare!
I wonder what the probability of ties is... I need to re-study the article on poker statistics.
W-well, that's just not fair! That hardly counts this late in the game!
Is that it?
Am I playing the game right? I would not take off my hairpieces one at a time, or my stockings one at a time either...
Is everything okay, ~target~? You seem to be stalling by removing something like that. You are not afraid, are you?
To think I could be stalling like ~target~ by removing all of my clothing one at a time... But would that not defeat the purpose of strip poker?
That was not particularly hard for you to remove, was it?
And nothing of value was lost. Now we can continue with the game!
Maybe you will play better once you start losing actual clothing.
Some strip poker joints consider accessories as cheating, you know!
Here is a fun fact for you: Stalling with accessories is often seen as bad manners in certain strip poker joints, since they defeat the purpose of the game.
Holding onto an unimportant item for so long in the game is an uncommon technique, but not unheard of. It is frequently utilized by people who are losing and want to stall the inevitable!
Are you afraid of removing real clothing, ~name~?
If you need suggestions for what to remove next, I would love to share mine.

Is it normal for the women of this culture to feel embarrassed by showing off their own bodies?
What even is the culture of this place...? Or is it more like a melting pot?
Take your time,~name~. The more time we spend together, the more time I have to study you and your playing patterns.
I hope to see more of you in the future.
Please, let us know if you are not willing to strip nude. That would save everyone a lot more time.
You don't have to strip if it makes you uncomfortable. But I advise you to not sign up for strip poker games in the future if that's the case.
That article was merely a stub. I hope you help improve the mood of the game by expanding the repertoire of articles you are willing to strip.
I look forward to seeing more of you, ~target~.
The more clothing you remove, the more I know about you! And knowledge is always exciting.
Go on, ~target~. I want to see more of you. All of you, if possible.
I'd better remember this. I do not want to forget about your ~clothing~ when I write the article on this place.

In medicine, a {b}prosthesis{!reset} or {b}prosthetic implant{!reset} is an artificial device that replaces a missing body part, which may be lost through trauma, disease, or a condition present at birth (congenital disorder).
Did you know that the term prosthesis derives from the Ancient Greek term meaning "addition, application, attachment"?
{b}War paint{!reset} is paint ritually applied to the face and/or body prior to going into a battle. It may also refer to Warpaint, a 2008 album by the Black Crowes.

{small}Military camouflage is the use of camouflage by an armed force to protect personnel and equipment from observation by enemy forces. The French slang word camouflage came into common English usage during World War I when the concept of visual deception developed into an essential part of modern military tactics.{!reset}

{small}Commando is a 1985 American action film directed by Mark L. Lester and starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Rae Dawn Chong, and Alyssa Milano. The term "commando" also refers to the act of going commando, or to go without underwear.{!reset}
An ecdysiast (pronounced ek-dee-siast) is a humorous yet accurate way to refer to what's commonly known as a stripper, if you do not want to be referred as such.

{small}Certain male deities representing regeneration and fertility were occasionally depicted with breast-like appendices, such as the river god Hapy who was considered to be responsible for the annual overflowing of the Nile.{!reset}

{small}The human penis is an external male intromittent organ that additionally serves as the urinary duct. The main parts are the root (radix); the body (corpus); and the epithelium of the penis including the shaft skin and the foreskin (prepuce) covering the glans penis.{!reset}
In modern society, nudity and clothing are connected to many cultural categories such as identity, privacy, social status, and moral behavior.

Much of this comes from the Abrahamic religions (Judaism, Christianity, and Islam), which have viewed being naked as shameful and essentially negative. But may I just say, you have nothing to be ashamed of!

{small}In Asia, the norms regarding public nudity are in keeping with the cultural values of social propriety and human dignity. Rather than being perceived as immoral or shameful, nakedness is perceived as a breach of etiquette.{!reset}

{small}In America, nudity is more likely to be seen sexually, while in much of Europe, there is more openness to non-sexual nudity in recreation and daily life. Although this does not really apply when we are playing strip poker...{!reset}

Your breasts may be underdeveloped, but your areolae and nipples seem to be perfectly functional!

{small}According to "Breast Size Perception and Satisfaction, Body Image, and Psychological Functioning in Caucasian and Asian American College Women" by Elissa Koff & Amy Benavage, many women regard their breasts as important to their sexual attractiveness, as a sign of femininity that is important to their sense of self. A woman with smaller breasts may regard her breasts as less attractive, but she should not have to!{!reset}

{small}Mammary intercourse is mostly suited for women with naturally larger breasts, while it is recommended that woman with smaller breasts be on top.
Smaller female breasts, however, tend to be more sensitive than larger ones.{!reset}

It has been said that breast implants are not flexible enough to sustain mammary intercourse.{small}[citation needed]{!reset}
So you should feel proud of your natural breasts!

{small}Scientists hypothesize that non-paraphilic sexual attraction to breasts is the result of their function as a secondary sex characteristic. The breasts play roles in both sexual pleasure and reproduction. Men typically find female breasts attractive and this holds true for a variety of cultures.{!reset}

{small}Zoologist and ethologist Desmond Morris theorizes that cleavage is a sexual signal that imitates the image of the cleft between the buttocks, which, according to Morris in The Naked Ape, is also unique to humans, other primates as a rule having much flatter buttocks.{!reset}

{small}Evolutionary psychologists theorize that humans' permanently enlarged breasts, in contrast to other primates' breasts, which only enlarge during ovulation, allows human females to "solicit [human] male attention and investment even when they are not really fertile."{!reset}
Sexual attraction to breasts is considered normal unless it is exclusive and is therefore a form of partialism.
There is a widespread fascination with women's breasts, and especially their size. Many people, both male and female, consider breasts an important female secondary sex characteristic.

{small}The basic components of a mature mammary gland are the alveoli (hollow cavities, a few millimeters large) lined with milk-secreting cuboidal cells and surrounded by myoepithelial cells. These alveoli join to form groups known as lobules. Each lobule has a lactiferous duct that drains into openings in the nipple.{!reset}

{small}In European pre-historic societies, sculptures of female figures with pronounced or highly exaggerated breasts were common. A typical example is the so-called Venus of Willendorf, one of many Paleolithic Venus figurines with ample hips and bosom. Artifacts such as bowls, rock carvings, and sacred statues with breasts have been recorded from 15,000 BC up to late antiquity all across Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East.{!reset}

{small}Many female deities representing love and fertility were associated with breasts and breast milk. Figures of the Phoenician goddess Astarte were represented as pillars studded with breasts. Isis, an Egyptian goddess who represented, among many other things, ideal motherhood, was often portrayed as suckling pharaohs, thereby confirming their divine status as rulers.{!reset}

{small}In Ancient Greece, there were several cults worshipping the "Kourotrophos," the suckling mother, represented by goddesses such as Gaia, Hera and Artemis. The worship of deities symbolized by the female breast in Greece became less common during the first millennium. The popular adoration of female goddesses decreased significantly during the rise of the Greek city states, a legacy which was passed on to the later Roman Empire.{!reset}
In Western society, there is an increasing trend towards {b}bralessness{!reset} among a number of women, especially millennials, who have expressed opposition to and are giving up wearing bras.
Going braless, which for many years was considered a political statement, has in recent years become fashionable. So no need to be ashamed, ~name~!
Women often choose to go braless due to discomfort, health-related issues, their cost, and for social reasons.
Articles on sexual organs are very popular, so I have seen many of these during my spellchecking editing sessions.

{b}Catfight{!reset} (also {b}girl fight{!reset}) is a term for an altercation between two females, often characterized as involving scratching, shoving, slapping, punching, kicking, biting, spitting, hair-pulling, and shirt-shredding.
The {b}catfight{!reset} has been a staple of American news media and popular culture since the 1940s, although the use of the term is often considered derogatory or belittling.
Some observers argue that in its purest form, the word refers to two women, one blonde and the other a brunette, fighting each other... In this case, is having light blue hair close enough to blonde?
Going without lower body undergarments has come to be known by the slang term {b}going commando.{!reset} Not to be confused with the 1985 action film Commando, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger.

A {b}backpack{!reset} has many names, such as {b}knapsack{!reset}, {b}rucksack{!reset}, {b}rucksac{!reset}, {b}pack{!reset}, {b}sackpack{!reset}, {b}booksack{!reset}, {b}bookbag{!reset}, {b}backsack{!reset}...
Backpacks are commonly used by hikers, students and soldiers. It is one of the most popular means of transportation of heavy loads or different equipment.
There are many types of backpacks in the world, such as rolling backpacks or hydration backpacks.

A {b}bandage{!reset} is a piece of material used either to support a medical device such as a dressing or splint, or on its own to provide support to or to restrict the movement of a part of the body.

{small}Bandages are available in a wide range of types, from generic cloth strips to specialized shaped bandages designed for a specific limb or part of the body. Bandages can often be improvised as the situation demands, using clothing, blankets or other material.{!reset}
Tight bandages can be used to slow blood flow to an extremity, such as when a leg or arm is bleeding heavily. Good thing that's not the case here, right?
A {b}bandana{!reset} is also known as a {b}bandanna{!reset} or a {b}kerchief{!reset}.
A {b}bandana{!reset} is a triangular or square piece of cloth usually worn on the face, neck or head for protective or decorative purposes.
Bandanas are mostly used to hold hair back, either as a fashionable head accessory, or for practical purposes.
Purple is certainly an uncommon color for hair. Then again, so is my blue hair... b-but it suits you well, Raven!
Alternative hair coloring products are designed to create hair colors not typically found in nature. These are also referred to as "vivid color" in the hairstyling industry.
Is your hair natural or dyed, Miss Raven? Either way, it suits you!

{small}Poltergeists have popularly been depicted in the film series Poltergeist, whose first movie was released in 1982. Not to be confused with Poultrygeist, a 2006 horror-comedy about a fast food restaurant overrun by zombie chickens.{!reset}

Some backpacks are equipped with solar panels and USB cables to charge laptops and phones that the wearer might carry in it.
Backpacks in general fall into one of four categories: frameless, external frame, internal frame, and bodypack. You can learn all about them in the Wikipedia article.
There are many types of bandages. The most popular ones are the adhesive ones, but there's also gauze, compression, triangular, tube, liquid...
Bandages can be used in martial arts to prevent dislocated joints. But lately, some have decided to use them for esthetic choices.

The word bandana stems from the Hindi words 'bāndhnū,' or "tie-dyeing," and 'bāndhnā,' "to tie."
Bandanas can be worn around the mouth and nose to protect from dust inhalation or to hide the identity of its wearer.
Bandanas can be worn around the neck to prevent sunburn. I often use them when going to the beach.

The G-spot is reportedly located roughly 5 cm (2.0 in) up on the anterior wall of the vagina, forwards toward the navel. On this day in 1998, the {b}Akashi Kaikyō Bridge{!reset} opened to traffic. It is the longest suspension bridge in the world, linking Awaji Island and Kobe in Japan.
On a sadder note, on this day in 1936, an F5 tornado struck Tupelo, Mississippi, and killed at least 216 people during {b}the second deadliest tornado outbreak in U.S. history.{!reset}
This day marks the anniversary of Kurt Cobain's death, as he passed away in 1994 at the age of 27.
Do you like sports, ~player~? Because on this day in 1886, the first modern {b}Olympic Games{!reset} opened in Athens, with athletes from 14 nations participating in 43 events!

{small}On this day, but back in 1652, a Dutch sailor named Jan van Riebeeck established a resupply camp at the Cape of Good Hope. That camp would eventually become Cape Town, the legislative capital of South Africa.{!reset}
On this day in 2001, NASA's {b}2001 Mars Odyssey{!reset} launched from Cape Canaveral. It is currently the longest-surviving continually active spacecraft in orbit around a planet other than Earth!
On a day just like this, but back in 1141, Empress Matilda became the first female ruler of England. Adopting the title of "Lady of the English".
On this day, back on 1805, Ludwig van Beethoven premiered his Third Symphony at the Theater an der Wien in Vienna. Would you like to listen to it with me after this game?
On this day in 1927, the first ever long-distance public television broadcast was... well, broadcasted. We have come a long way since then!

{small}On this day, but back in 1948, the United Nations established the World Health Organization (WHO) to act as a coordinating authority on international public health. And years later, America would cut funding for the WHO for some reason.{!reset}
Psst. Hey, ~player~. You're not supposed to see this.
On this day in 2001, the Netherlands became the first country to legalize same-sex marriage.
Did you know that on this day in 2004, Google announced Gmail for the first time?
On this day in 1979, Nickelodeon launched in the United States, leaving behind it's old name of Pinwheel. Is that not interesting or what?
Do you like Apple products, ~player~? Apple Inc. was formed by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak and Ronald Wayne back on April 1, 1976!
On this day in 1944, the United States bombed the Swiss city of Schaffhausen due to navigation errors. This is why aeronautical radio operators are important, people!
On this day in 2021, I was added to Strip Poker Night at the Inventory! Yay me!

{small}On this day in 1982, Argentina invaded the Falklands under the orders of its military dictatorship as an attempt to regain the population's patriotic feelings, calculating that the United Kingdom wouldn't respond. But they didn't know that Margaret Thatcher needed to regain her country's trust as well, and reclaiming the islands did just that! Isn't that interesting?{!reset}
Did you know that on this day in 1800, Ludwig van Beethoven led the premiere of his First Symphony in Vienna? Why don't you give it a listen?

{small}On this day in 2005, the first non-Italian pope since the 16th Century, John Paul II, left this mortal plane. He was born as Karol Józef Wojtyła from Poland, and was succeeded by the German Joseph Ratzinger, and later the aAgentinian Jorge Bergoglio.{!reset}

Hey ~player~, today is World Autism Awareness Day! It's one of only seven official health-specific UN Days, recognizing the importance of research, treatment, and acceptance for people with autism spectrum disorders.
I hope you do not mind that I am using the remaining time to think about the article I will write once I get home.
Now that I think about it, I should have charged my phone beforehand... I could have written so much already...
This was a very different experience than what I expected from the Inventory... But I liked it nonetheless!
If you are feeling bored, ~player~, did you know that there is a site where you can watch Wikipedia edits in real time? Check it out: {u}listen.hatnote.com{!reset}
Is there any particular topic you wish to know about, ~player~? Remember that you can offer your feedback after the game, so I can read your thoughts more appropiately.
Just like how this game is ending soon, on this day back in 1559 the Habsburg–Valois War was coming to an end.
It's hard to think about, but the first successful portable computer was unveiled on this day four decades ago!
Well, I was not exactly successful at this game... But neither was the US Air Force CT-43, when they crashed into a mountainside during a failed instrument approach on this day in 1996.
Do you like Fred Astaire? Well, on this day in 1955, Fred Astaire appeared on television for the first time on The Toast of the Town with Ed Sullivan!
On this day in 2008, Apple became the number one music seller in the United States.
On this day in 1882, American outlaw Jesse James was killed by Robert Ford. This would be depicted in the 2007 film The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford.
On this day in 1968, Stanley Kubrick's film 2001: A Space Odyssey was released in the United States. It would go on to achieve critical acclaim.
To think that on this day just 50 years ago, Apollo 6 was launched... I was not even born yet, so I am thankful for being able to read all about it on Wikipedia!

{small}On this day four decades ago, Bill Gates and Paul Allen founded Microsoft in Albuquerque, New Mexico. I wonder what kinds of world-changing projects, foundations and alliances are happening now as we speak...{!reset}
On this day five decades ago, the first temporary artificial heart was implanted. Are you not amazed at how medicine has progressed since then?
Have you ever gone to a circus, ~player~? Because on this day three centuries ago, the first modern circus was staged for the first time!
It is hard to imagine that on this day two hundred years ago, the Kennel Club was founded. Do you think a dog is defined by its race, ~player~?
Boy, today is going to be a busy day... It is the anniversary of Martin Luther King Jr.'s death. And the trolls are going to get wild trying to vandalize any non-protected article surrounding him...

{small}On this day in 1994, the Beatles made music history by holding the top five places in the singles charts with "Can't Buy Me Love," "Twist and Shout," "She Loves You," "I Want to Hold Your Hand," and "Please Please Me."{!reset}
By the way, as much as I love Wikipedia, I have to admit that it is not a reliable source. Wikipedia itself has an article saying so.
On this day in 1911, American cartoonist {b}Winsor McCay{!reset} released the silent short film {b}Little Nemo,{!reset} one of the earliest animated films.
On this day in 1994, the RIAA announced that Pink Floyd's 1973 album The Dark Side of the Moon had become the fourth biggest-selling album in U.S. history, passing the 13 million mark in sales.
Do you like punk rock, ~player~? Because on this day in 1977, the Clash's self-titled debut album was released in the UK! What are your favorite songs by the Clash?

{small}On a day like this, but back in 1860, Édouard-Léon Scott de Martinville made the oldest known recording of a human voice on his phonautograph. We have come a long way since then! Would you like this game to play human voices?{!reset}

{small}Today in 1937, the airplane Kamikaze (registration J-BAAI) landed in London, becoming the first Japanese-built aircraft to fly from Japan to Europe. To commemorate the occasion, sake bottles and cups with the image of this aircraft on it were produced.{!reset}
On a day just like this one back in in 1991, Georgia declared its independence from the Soviet Union! Well, the Soviet Union disbanded that same year, but it is still a date to celebrate.
Did you know that today, but back in 1959, the Mercury Seven were announced to the public? They were the selection of the United States' first seven astronauts!
On this day in 1970, the Beatles' bassist Sir Paul McCartney quit the band, much to the sadness of fans. He would go on to have a successful solo career.
Did you know that on this day in 2007, Apple announced it had sold its one-hundred millionth iPod? Remember iPods? How quickly technology changes!
On a regular day just like this one, but back in 1939, the "Big Book" of Alcoholics Anonymous was first published. Pretty interesting, right?
Do you celebrate Arbor Day, ~player~? You should! It is quite nice, and the first Arbor Day ever was celebrated in Nebraska on this day back in 1872.

{small}Have you ever wondered how a black hole looks like, ~player~? Many people did for dozens of years... until recently, since the Event Horizon Telescope showed us the first image of a real black hole on this day in 2019.{!reset}

{small}You never know where you will find a surprise, ~player~. Like the construction workers in Linyi, Shandong who accidentally found tombs with bamboo slips, including Sun Tzu's The Art of War, om this day back in 1972.{!reset}

{small}On this day back in 1971, John Denver's "Take Me Home Country Roads" hit the Billboard Hot 100, becoming Denver's first appearance on the charts. Do you want to sing that song with me, ~name~?{!reset}

This day marked the release of F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel The Great Gatsby in 1925, which has since become required reading in most English classes. So many high schoolers choose to skim my page instead of reading it...
There is always a first time for everything, ~player~! Like how Napoleon Bonaparte had to abdicate unconditionally for the first time today in 1814, due to the Treaty of Fountainebleau!
Have you ever been to Tel-Aviv, ~player~? They are probably celebrating right now, since their city was founded today in 1909!
Are you a fan of Apple products, ~player~? Because the Apple I was created on this day, back in 1976.
Fifty years feels so distant... and yet so close. Like how people watching the Apollo 13 launch felt today in 1970.

{small}Did you know that today in 2002, over two hundred thousand people marched in Caracas, Venezuela to demand the resignation of the then-president Hugo Chávez? Not only did he not resign, but his elected successor is still in power to this day... But I hold hope for our Venezuelan contributors.{!reset}

{small}People usually forget how close the past is! The United States' Civil Rights Act, the one prohibiting discrimination in the sale, rental, and financing of housing due to race, religion, or national origin, has only been in effect since it was enacted on this day back in 1968!{!reset}
This day saw the release of Singin' in the Rain in 1952, with Gene Kelly in the lead!

{small}On this day in 1963, Bob Dylan performed his first major solo concert at Town Hall in New York City. He would go on to release a total of 39 studio albums, becoming one of the most prolific and widely covered songwriters of the 20th century.{!reset}
This day saw the first launch of NASA's Space Shuttle Columbia in 1981! Columbia was the first of five Space Shuttles and would be the first flight in a program that would last 30 more years.

{small}On this day in 1943, the Jefferson Memorial in Washington, D.C., was formerly dedicated on the 200th anniversary of president, architect, and university founder Thomas Jefferson's birth. It was built in the Neoclassical style that Jefferson was known for.{!reset}
On this day in 1970, Led Zeppelin became the first band to sell out the Montreal Forum.
On this day in 2000, American metal band Metallica filed a lawsuit against Napster, in an infamous move that would be linked to the downfall of the company.

On this day in 1980, British heavy metal band Iron Maiden released their self-titled debut album. It was the first of two with original lead singer Paul Di'Anno, before his replacement by the Bruce Dickinson.
On this day in 2019, a fire severely damaged Notre-Dame de Paris, destroying the cathedral's spire and much of its roof. I wonder how Notre-Dame-chan is doing these days...
I did not expect to win my first game ever! Thank you for this experience. It was very... informative!
This experience was quite informative. But I am not done yet! There are more things to discover about this place, and I will write an article about it!
I win again! It is always so much fun to play with everyone. I hope we can do it again!
I won again! Maybe next time I will get to write about the masturbation phase, but for now, I will keep writing about winning!
This has been an eye-opening and informative game! I look forward to coming again! Now, to write that article...
You had better be donating all of that to Wikipedia, or I will be {b}VERY UPSET!{!reset}
H-hey! Give that back! I am friends with Jimbo Wales, I can have you banned! {b}I WILL DO IT, TOO!{!reset}
It is always a pleasure to play with you again, ~player~! I hope we meet in another table soon!
I may have lost this time, but there is so much data I can add to my next article! Thank you so much everyone!
Such a fascinating experience! Maybe I should come back here more often? If you think I should, you should say so in the Feedback button!
I guess not all games can be won. But this was still a very informative experience! Thank you for your help, everyone!
This was fun! And I have learned so much from this experience. Perhaps I should come back more often? Be sure to tell me what you think of the idea by clicking the Feedback button!
What? Oh, is the game over already? Well, good game, everyone! Sorry I got a little lost in a paradox. I hope we can play together again sometime!
This was a fascinating experience! I would love to play with all of you again!
This was so much fun! I forgot how thrilling investigation could be. I hope we can play together next time!
...However, if Wikipedia says that it is not a reliable source... does that mean that article is not reliable?
But if that article saying that Wikipedia is not a realible source is not reliable itself, that would imply that Wikipedia is a reliable source.
But if Wikipedia was a reliable source, that would mean that the article saying that Wikipedia is not a reliable source would be reliable.
